IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Provide Home Health Care services to the community.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Sholom is a not-for-profit organization providing a broad continuum of residential, social service, and health care services primarily for older adults.
IRS990.Description: Provides home health care services to residents of the various facilities owned and operated by Sholom Community Alliance and in the community. Provides hospice care services throughout Sholom Community Alliance facilities and in the community.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part II, Line 12, Explanation of Other Income: Other Income
Schedule A, Part IV, Supplemental Information: Schedule A, Part III, Line 12, Explanation for other income: Other Income

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: BRUCE KAHN - DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN - $22,000 Michael Klien - Deferred compensation plan - $12,667

PART I, LINE 3: THE CEO'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE, THE SOLE MEMBER OF SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE HOME HEALTHCARE. THE FOLLOWING WERE USED BY SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE IN DETERMINING THE CEO'S COMPENSATION: 1. COMPENSATION COMMITTEE 2. INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT 3. WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT 4. COMPENSATION SURVEY OR STUDY 5. APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Allen Freeman & Mark Freeman - Father/Son Allen Freeman & Nancy Getzkin - Father/Daughter Allen Freeman & Neil Borenstein - Father-inlaw/Son-in-law Mark Freeman & Nancy Getzkin - Brother/Sister Mark Freeman & Neil Broenstein - Brother-in-laws Neil Broenstein & Nancy Getzkin - Brother-in-law/Sister-in-law Lori Kamin & Sandy Kamin - Sister-in-laws Lisa Lane & Polly Saxon - Sister-in-laws Ed Sherman & Doris Sherman - Husband/Wife

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Sholom Community Alliance is the sole member of Sholom Community Alliance Home Healthcare.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE DIRECTORS ARE ELECTED AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE SOLE MEMBER, SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE. THE BOARD MEMBERS OF SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE HAVE ELECTED THEMSELVES TO BE THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE HOME HEALTHCARE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AMENDMENTS TO THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND BYLAWS REQUIRE THE APPROVAL OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 tax return was reviewed in detail by management, then by the budget and finance committee and the board president. The 990 was then presented to the board of directors for review and approval prior to singing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board members and employees sign for receipt of policy which covers all employees and officers. Compliance is monitored via various means including financial audit, board minutes, and investigation of complaints. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST MUST BE DISCLOSED AT THE TIME OF KNOWLEDGE OF THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, OR, IF APPROPRIATE, THE CHAIR OF THE COMMITTEE EVALUATING THE PARTICULAR MATTER AND THE CEO. THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR ANY DESIGNEE WILL EVALUATE THE APPROPRIATENESS OF THE BOARD MEMBER TO BE INVOLVED IN ANY DISCUSSIONS AND/OR VOTING ON THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST ISSUE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING COMPENSATION FOR CORPORATE OFFICERS. Corporate Director of HR establishes compensation ranges based on salary survey data and documents same. Last completed in 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's financial statements are available upon request. The organization's governing documents and conflict of interest policy are not open to public inspection.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Allocation of Time between related organizations
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The officers of the organization - Bruce Kahn, Michael Klien, and Michael Hanson - also serve as the officers of sholom community alliance and each of its affiliates. See schedule R, Part II for a list of the affiliates. Each officer spends approximately the same amount of time serving each of the related organizations, for a total of 40 hours per week. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SHOLOM FOUNDATION AND SHOLOM ST. PAUL, THE BOARD MEMBERS OF SHOLOM COMMUNITY ALLIANCE ALSO SERVE AS THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF EACH OF THE RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. THE FOLLOWING ALSO SERVE ON THE BOARD OF DIRCTORS OF SHOLOM FOUNDATION; ALLEN FREEOMAN, JEFF RINGER, WENDY BLADINGER, STEVE BRAND, JAY GOLDBERG, NANCY GETZKIN, ROBERT KARON, AND JON GORDON. THE FOLLOWING ALSO SERVE ON THE BOARD OF DIRCTORS OF SHOLOM ST. PAUL; ALLEN FREEMAN, MARK FREEMAN, JEFF RINGER, WENDY BALDINGER, STEVE BRAND, BARRY NEWMAN, NANCY GETZKIN, ROBERT KARON AND JON GORDON. EACH BOARD MEMBER SPENDS APPROXIMATELY THE SAME AMOUNT OF TIME SERVING EACH OF THE RELATED ORGANIZATIONS, FOR A TOTAL OF 1 HOUR PER WEEK.
